alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:47PM EST until January 10 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 2:19 AM and 2:33 PM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 12:23 AM and 1:17 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 1:43 AM and 1:57 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/01 PM 3.6 2.0 2.2 3.0 Moderate 11/01 AM 2.4 0.8 1.3 1.0 None 11/01 PM 2.6 1.0 1.2 1.0 None 12/02 AM 2.4 0.8 1.2 0.5 None 12/02 PM 2.7 1.1 1.3 1.0 None 13/03 AM 3.5 1.9 2.2 3.0 Moderate &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
